did.abstract: This collection consists of various items dating from 1955 to 1968 and related to Alice L. Wood's role as publisher of the periodicals Bookniks and The Friendly World. Items include issues of the periodicals, world holiday calendars, newsletters, correspondence, paper cut-out designs, and publicity material. Also included is a paper written by Wood on the history of the artificial feeding of infants, written while Wood was attending the Teachers College at Columbia University.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Alice L. Wood attended the Teachers College at Columbia University in New York City. She later moved to Brooklyn Heights and published the periodicals Bookniks and The Friendly World from her home. Both periodicals were devoted to promoting world peace and international understanding.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of various items dating from 1955 to 1968 and related to Alice L. Wood's role as publisher of the periodicals Bookniks and The Friendly World. Items include issues of the periodicals, world holiday calendars, newsletters, correspondence, paper cut-out designs, and publicity material. Also included is a paper written by Wood on the history of the artificial feeding of infants, written while Wood was attending the Teachers College at Columbia University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Alice L. Wood, date unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.
